title: Database Administrator
description:
Position Summary:

Responsible for maintaining database performance, availability, security, and data integrity in a 24/7 environment. This role collaborates within a team to execute projects and operational tasks while providing technical expertise and guidance to team members.
The DBA must be local to the Irvine, CA or Plano, TX Area.

Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrated 5+ year’s experience working as a MS SQL Server administrator.
  • Strong understanding of SQL database monitoring and performance tuning.
  • Advanced knowledge of HA and DR options.
  • Ability to develop automation and scripts to automate tasks and tools to reduce DBA manual touch points (Hands-on experience scripting in PowerShell or any other scripting tool).
  • Contributes to the direction of Azure cloud migration.
  • Implements, maintains & troubleshoots database replication (SQL Server replication and 3rd Party tools, i.e. Fivetran, Qlik etc.).
  • Understands the DBA challenges, delivers a technical solution that meets the unique needs of DBAs with innovation and automation.
  • Learns continuously, leveraging training resources and self-directed training, sharing knowledge and skills with the rest of the team.
  • Completed multiple migrations/upgrades.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred in Computer Science or related IT field or equivalent work experience.
  • Minimum five (5) + years of production DBA experience.
  • Minimum three (2) + years SQL development experience.
  • PowerShell experience.
  • Cloud migrations - Microsoft Azure and/or AWS.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with automation/innovation.
  • Extensive experience in High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for MSSQL and Azure SQL.
  • Experience with replication in multi-server/datacenter environments.
  • Experience with multi-datacenter environment, including stretched data center to Azure or AWS.
  • Participates in “On-Call” rotation within the Team.
  • Experience with SSRS development, SSDT in conjunction with TFS and GIT source control.
  • Experience working with CI and Software Engineering teams.
  • Active participation in Governance, including data access, encryption, and masking best practices.
  • Experience monitoring and supporting ETL pipelines (i.e. Azure Data Factory, SSIS).
  • Experience with any of the following would be GREAT to have:
    • Databricks
    • NoSQL (i.e. Mongo, Cosmos DB, CouchDB, etc....)
    • Graph Databases (i.e. Neo4J)
    • Microsoft Purview

loanDepot (NYSE: LDI) is a digital commerce company committed to serving its customers throughout the home ownership journey. With headquarters in Southern California and offices nationwide, loanDepot is committed to serving the communities in which its team lives and works through a variety of local, regional, and national philanthropic efforts.

title: IT & Data Systems Coordinator
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

Today’s Resident Services is a non-profit organization affiliated with The Inter-Faith Group (IFG), which is an alliance of seven independently operated non-profits that share a collective mission to create quality affordable housing and support services to families. Our team members are expected to embrace, exemplify and uphold our core values of Stewardship, Hard-working, Well-respected, Innovation, and Neighborly cooperation (SHWIN), in order to foster positive relationships both within the organization and with external stakeholders.

We are seeking a tech-savvy and detail-oriented IT & Data Systems Coordinator to manage the organization’s digital infrastructure, technology assets, and data systems. This role serves as the bridge between operations, data management, and IT services, ensuring that staff and systems have the tools and support they need to operate efficiently and securely. The ideal candidate is a self-reliant problem solver who enjoys variety in their work, from data reporting and system troubleshooting to managing technology assets and vendor relationships. This person thrives in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment where reliability, accuracy, and initiative are valued. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

IT Operations & Systems Management

  • Procure, configure, and manage all corporate hardware (computers, laptops, tablets, etc.) and software.
  • Optimize company-wide hardware, software, and digital security to ensure smooth and secure operations.
  • Maintain and track all software licenses, digital subscriptions, and memberships.
  • Provide day-to-day IT support and troubleshooting to staff during business hours.
  • Evaluate, recommend, and implement improvements for systems such as phone lines, internet service, cloud storage, and shared drives.
  • Manage relationships with third-party IT vendors, ensuring timely resolution of issues and project completion.
  • Order, store, and secure software and hardware inventory for company use.

Staff Technology Support

  • Coordinate and complete all IT and digital onboarding for new hires (accounts, devices, permissions, etc.).
  • Coordinate and complete IT and digital offboarding for exiting personnel to ensure data security.
  • Create and maintain IT documentation for system access, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.

Data Systems & Reporting

  • Prepare and submit monthly invoices to PRS accounting for DEC services.
  • Pull and maintain detailed monthly reports for clients and other stakeholders upon request.
  • Troubleshoot issues with CRM/Pulse data reports and entry systems.
  • Improve and maintain digital forms, calendars, and reporting templates to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
  • Manage high volumes of data-related work while ensuring deadlines and data integrity are met.

Leadership & Coordination

  • Assign and distribute property workloads based on staffing changes.
  • Interview, hire, and train new Data Entry Clerks or other IT/data support roles.
  • Collaborate cross-departmentally to align IT and data practices with organizational needs.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES)

  • Associate degree (preferred) or 2-5 years of relevant experience.
  • Strong working knowledge of CRM systems, data management, and cloud platforms.
  • Experience with IT procurement, vendor management, and software licensing.
  • Familiarity with troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues.
  • Excellent communication, organization, and multitasking skills.
  • Experience in a non-profit or service-oriented organization is a plus.

Benefits:

  • Employer paid Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
  • 401(k) matching up to 5>#/li###
  • Employee Assistance Program - available to employees and family members
  • Flexible Spending account- Medical or Dependent Care
  • Disability and Life Insurance
  • Generous PTO and Holiday package

title: Cloud Database Engineer - Apple Ads
description:
At Apple, we focus deeply on our customers’ experience. Apple Ads brings this same approach to advertising, helping people find exactly what they’re looking for and helping advertisers grow their businesses.

Our technology powers ads and sponsorships across Apple Services, including the App Store, Apple News, and MLS Season Pass. Everything we do is designed for trust, connection, and impact: We respect user privacy, integrate advertising thoughtfully into the experience, and deliver value for advertisers of all sizes - from small app developers to big, global brands. Because when advertising is done right, it benefits everyone.

The Database Solutions team within Apple Ads defines and implements database technologies, standards, and optimizations that ensure reliability, performance, and efficiency at scale. The team partners closely with Ads engineering and infrastructure groups to enable product delivery through design, configuration, and automation of a large fleet of cloud databases supporting Apple Ads applications.

We are looking for a Cloud Database Engineer to help build and evolve the next generation of Apple Ads’ cloud database architecture - enabling fast, reliable, and scalable data operations across AWS-based environments supporting both transactional and analytical workloads.

Description

In this role, you will design, provision, and automate database solutions across Aurora Postgres, Aurora MySQL, MongoDB, CockroachDB, and other distributed SQL or NoSQL platforms. You’ll focus on enabling automation, observability, and optimization for the database services that power Apple Ads’ large-scale applications.

The person in this role will:

  • Partner with engineering teams to understand data access patterns and recommend purpose-built cloud databases that best meet performance, reliability, and cost goals.

  • Build and enhance Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) modules for secure and automated provisioning, configuration, and compliance of database resources.

  • Develop Python or Go-based automation for deployment, monitoring, and self-healing operations.

  • Optimize and tune production database performance, troubleshoot complex issues, and improve resilience and observability.

  • Contribute to cloud migration and modernization initiatives, completing the transition from on-premises to AWS-managed databases.

  • Evaluate emerging database technologies (e.g., distributed SQL, NewSQL) and advocate for adoption where appropriate.

  • Participate in an on-call rotation for escalations (weekly, during U.S. business hours).

This is not a traditional DBA role. The ideal candidate combines a deep understanding of database internals with a cloud engineering and automation mindset - someone who designs solutions, not just maintains systems.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience leading data modernization or cloud migration projects

Knowledge of change data capture (CDC) frameworks such as GoldenGate, Debezium or AWS DMS

Exposure to containerized or serverless database deployments (e.g., RDS on EKS, Aurora Serverless)

Prior experience in Ad Tech or other high-scale distributed systems environments

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field; Master’s degree preferred

Minimum Qualifications

5+ years of experience engineering and operating cloud databases at scale (AWS preferred)

Strong hands-on experience with Aurora Postgres/MySQL and database migration or modernization from on-prem to cloud

Proven experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) for database provisioning and policy compliance

Scripting proficiency in Python (preferred) or Go, with working knowledge of Shell scripting

Familiarity with NoSQL or distributed SQL databases (MongoDB, CockroachDB, DynamoDB, etc.)

Solid understanding of database performance tuning, observability, and root cause analysis

Experience implementing high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) strategies in multi-region environments

Knowledge of database security and AWS networking fundamentals (IAM, VPC, encryption, private endpoints)

Excellent collaboration and communication skills - able to partner effectively with software engineers and SREs

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

title: Senior Cloud Database Administrator
description:
Overview
For this role, we are seeking a Senior Cloud Database Administrator with a balance of skills in database design, physical implementation, and performance tuning. You will be part of a team that is supporting cloud Data Warehouse and Data Lake environments implemented on AWS or Azure for some of Epsilon's most prominent Database Marketing clients.

What You'll Do
  • Develop, configure, and manage Data Warehouse database systems and cloud platform work.
  • Supervise and report on performance metrics, system health, and logging compliance for database services and appliances.
  • Perform core DBA tasks: backup/recovery, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and SQL optimization.
  • Design database schemas and optimize data types and distribution for peak performance.
  • Configure and implement workload management for resource allocation and query handling.
  • Support users and troubleshoot data access applications and ad hoc queries.
  • Develop and maintain shell scripts for database activities (data loading, unloading, maintenance).
  • Manage data replication, encryption, backup storage, and archiving procedures.
  • Ensure compliance with standards and best practices for availability, security, backup/recovery, and data integrity.
  • Evaluate new database technologies and recommend solutions to technical leadership.
  • Chip in on documentation of database standards, guidelines, and operational procedures.
  • Manage multiple client engagements, leveraging experience and judgment to plan and deliver results.
  • Participate in 24x7x365 on-call rotation for production support.

About you:
  • Thrive both in a team environment and working independently.
  • Good interpersonal skills and a collaborative approach.
  • Take ownership of problems through resolution.
  • Celebrate team success and seek opportunities for growth.
  • Motivated to build a long-term career with a leading company.

What you'll bring:
  • BS in Computer Science or a related technical field (or equivalent experience).
  • 4-6 years of general database administration experience.
  • 3+ years handling Data Warehouse technologies (e.g., IBM Netezza, Greenplum, or similar Postgres-based appliances).
  • 1+ years handling cloud database services (e.g., Amazon Redshift, AWS RDS for Postgres, Aurora Postgres, Snowflake, Databricks).
  • Experience working with vendor support to resolve issues within SLA.
  • Ability to write and optimize complex SQL queries and interpret query plans.
  • Proficiency in analyzing database statistics and performance metrics.
  • Familiarity with programming languages like Python or Scala (a plus).
  • Solid understanding of backup/recovery methodologies.
  • Ability to diagnose and resolve issues across application, database, network, and appliance tiers.
  • Adhering to SDLC, Change Management, and troubleshooting procedures.
  • Solid Unix/Linux and shell scripting skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication.

Click here to view how Epsilon transforms marketing with 1 View, 1 Vision, 1 Voice.

Additional Information
When You Join Us, We'll Create Something EPIC Together
Epsilon is a global data, technology and services company that powers the marketing and advertising ecosystem. For decades, we've provided marketers from the world's leading brands the data, technology and services they need to engage consumers with 1 View, 1 Vision and 1 Voice. 1 View of their universe of potential buyers. 1 Vision for engaging each individual. And 1 Voice to harmonize engagement across paid, owned and earned channels.

Epsilon's comprehensive portfolio of capabilities across our suite of digital media, messaging and loyalty solutions bridge the divide between marketing and advertising technology. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each day using advanced AI and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Epsilon is a global company with more than 9,000 employees around the world.

Epsilon has a core set of 5 values that define our culture and guide us to create value for our clients, our people and consumers. We are seeking candidates that align with our company values, demonstrate them and make them meaningful in their day-to-day work:
  • Act with integrity. We are transparent and have the courage to do the right thing.
  • Work together to win together. We believe collaboration is the catalyst that unlocks our full potential.
  • Innovate with purpose. We shape the market with big ideas that drive big outcomes.
  • Respect all voices. We embrace differences and foster a culture of connection and belonging.
  • Empower with accountability. We trust each other to own and deliver on common goals.

Because You Matter
As an Epsilon employee, you deserve perks and benefits that put you, your family and your finances first. Our benefits encompass a wide range of offerings, including but not limited to the following:
  • Time to Recharge: Flexible time off (FTO), 15 paid holidays
  • Time to Recover: Paid sick time
  • Family Well-Being: Parental/new child leave, childcare & elder care assistance, adoption assistance
  • Extra Perks: Comprehensive health coverage, 401(k), tuition assistance, commuter benefits, professional development, employee recognition, charitable donation matching, health coaching and counseling

Epsilon benefits are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms.

Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon's policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process. Please reach out to LeaveofAbsence@epsilon.com to request an accommodation.

For San Francisco Bay and Los Angeles Areas: Epsilon will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901-4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants with criminal histories are welcome to apply.

title: Senior Engineer - Oracle DBA
description:
At Alcon, we are driven by the meaningful work we do to help people see brilliantly. We innovate boldly, champion progress, and act with speed as the global leader in eye care. Here, you’ll be recognized for your commitment and contributions and see your career like never before. Together, we go above and beyond to make an impact in the lives of our patients and customers. We foster an inclusive culture and are looking for diverse, talented people to join Alcon.
We are seeking a Senior Oracle DBA Engineer to join our Information Systems Operations Management team at Alcon in Fort Worth. You will be responsible for ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of enterprise-level Oracle databases that support Alcon’s global operations. You’ll lead initiatives to automate database processes, improve system reliability, and implement best practice. In this role a typical day will include:
  • Administer and maintain Oracle databases with a focus on performance, security, and availability.
  • Automate the installation, configuration, and maintenance of Oracle software and related infrastructure.
  • Manage Oracle Multitenant architecture and support multiple pluggable databases (PDBs).
  • Implement robust backup, recovery, and disaster recovery procedures.
  • Monitor and manage Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM) infrastructure for production environments.
  • Develop and maintain Unix/Linux shell scripts for database operations and system automation.
  • Collaborate with infrastructure, application, and security teams to ensure seamless integrations and compliance with organizational standards.
  • Enforce and routinely update database security standards and protocols.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues, database errors, and service disruptions.
  • Participate in source code management and release processes related to database scripts and configurations.
  • Provide guidance and mentoring to junior DBAs; lead project-based database initiatives.
WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO ALCON:
  • Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent years of directly related experience (or high school +13 yrs; Assoc.+9 yrs; M.S.+2 yrs; PhD+0 yrs)
  • The ability to fluently read, write, understand and communicate in English
  • 5 Years of Relevant Experience
Preferred qualifications:
  • Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field; or equivalent professional experience preferred.
  • Proven experience as a Database Administrator (DBA), with strong expertise in Oracle databases, multitenant architecture, and data guard configurations.
  • Experience managing Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM).
  • Proficiency with Unix/Linux scripting and automation.
  • Solid understanding of backup and recovery techniques, including RMAN.
  • Familiarity with DevOps tools and version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Strong troubleshooting, documentation, and communication skills.
  • Leadership experience or prior involvement in mentoring/junior DBA support is a plus.
HOW YOU CAN THRIVE AT ALCON:
  • Join Alcon’s mission to provide top-tier, innovative products, and solutions to enhance sight & enhance lives.
  • Grow your career and see your impact in a highly collaborative and diverse environment.
  • Alcon provides robust benefits package including health, life, retirement, flexible time off, and much more!

title: Database Administrator (Austin)
description:
Description


WHO WE ARE:
Texas Workforce Commission connects people with careers across the state. While we are based in Austin on the north lawn of the Texas State Capitol, we have offices statewide. We're a Family Friendly Certified Workplace with great work-life balance, competitive salaries, extensive opportunities for training and development, and fantastic benefits. This position is based at 1411 Brazos St, Austin.

TWC is not considering applications from individuals who require sponsorship for an employment visa, including those currently on student or postgraduate visas. You must be a Texas resident to work for the Texas Workforce Commission or willing to relocate to Texas.


WHO YOU ARE:
Seeking an IT professional to provide support in the design and maintenance of database structures and develop policies and procedures designed to ensure the integrity of the database environment. The ideal candidate will have experience in designing, recommending, and implementing procedures necessary to backup and recovery databases from hardware and software failures. Must have the ability to communicate in a professional, customer-focused manner. Collaborates with other IT teams as well as business customers to accomplish work.


WHAT YOU WILL DO:
The Database Administrator is selected by and accountable to the Data Governance Officer with the approval of the Chief Information Officer. Performs highly complex to advanced (senior-level) database administration work. Work involves providing direction and guidance in database administration operations and planning; providing for the efficient and effective storage, retrieval, customization, and archiving of data to ensure integrated database systems; planning, developing, and implementing database policies and procedures; and maintaining and verifying data integrity. Work is performed under limited to minimal supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. May supervise the work of others. Maintains a reliable, predictable work schedule. May be called upon to work outside of normal business hours to sustain operations or complete urgent assignments.


YOU WILL BE TRUSTED TO:
  • Documents database processes and interfaces.
  • Defines and documents the technical architecture of the mainframe DB2 database, including the physical components and their functionality, data models and data dictionaries.
  • Coordinates activities with the rest of the Mainframe DBA team and with developers.
  • Assists in promoting DB2 database objects from lower to higher environments.
  • Creates and maintains data models and data dictionaries.
  • Performs other analysis and documentation tasks as required to facilitate and support TWC’s mainframe DB2 database.
  • Maintains disaster recovery procedures and participate in disaster recovery tests and actual recoveries as needed.
  • May develop and conduct training and/or give expert advice on database/information availability, design policies and standards and database query tools.
  • May work outside normal office hours and days when needed to resolve production issues and provide on-call activities.
  • Ensures compliance with all Federal, State, and agency laws, rules, policies, and procedures, including IT Handbook and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), that govern TWC IT.
  • Contributes to teamwork and communicates effectively.
  • Promotes an image of IT excellence.
  • Maintains a reliable, predictable work schedule.
  • May be called upon to work outside of normal business hours to sustain operations or complete urgent assignments.
  • Performs other duties as assigned to maintain IT operations.

YOU ARE A GREAT FIT WITH:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer information systems, computer science, management information systems, or related technical field and 6 years’ related work experience.
  • Experience and understanding of mainframe based relational databases.
  • Experience overseeing the design and maintenance of database structures and developing policies and procedures designed to ensure the integrity of the database environment.
  • Experience assessing future information requirements, develops goals and objectives for improvement and use of an efficient and cost-effective database system.
  • Experience in designing, recommending, and implementing procedures necessary to backup and recovery databases from hardware and software failures.
  • Recommends and implements necessary database security standards and controls. Detail oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work cooperatively with a team of database administrators, analysts and developers to complete work assignments.
  • Ability to communicate technical information effectively, both orally and in writing to establish and maintain effective working relationships with customers, coworkers, and vendors.
  • Ability to work independently while understanding the need for communicating and coordinating work efforts with others.
  • Ability to analyze complex information and develop plans to address identified issues.

YOU QUALIFY WITH:
  • Database Administrator III: Three years of full-time experience in computer programming and/or systems analysis.
  • Database Administrator IV: Four years of full-time experience in computer programming and/or systems analysis.
  • Both Levels: Relevant academic credits may be applied toward experience qualifications for this position.

YOU GAIN:
  • A Family Friendly Certified Workplace
-Competitive starting salary: $7,000.00 - $8,750.00/month
  • Defined Retirement Benefit Plan
  • Optional 401(k) and 457 accounts
  • Medical Insurance
  • Paid time off, including time for vacation, sick and family care leave
  • Additional benefits for active employees can be found at https://www.ers.texas.gov/Active-Employees/Health-Benefits.


VETERANS:
Use your military skills to qualify for this position or other jobs! Go to www.texasskillstowork.com to translate your military work experience and training courses into civilian job terms, qualifications, and skill sets. Also, you can compare this position to military occupations (MOS) at the Texas State Auditor's Office by pasting this link into your browser: https://hr.sao.texas.gov/Compensation/MilitaryCrosswalk/MOSC_InformationTechnology.pdf


HOW TO APPLY:
To be considered, please complete a State of Texas Application for Employment and apply online at www.workintexas.com or on Taleo (Job Search).
TWC is not considering applications from individuals who require sponsorship for an employment visa, including those currently on student or postgraduate visas.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

A position utilizing this classification will be designated as security sensitive according to the Texas Labor Code, Section 301.042.

Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Regular
Job Type: Standard
Job Level: Non-Management
Travel: No

Work From Home: Yes

title: Platform Data Engineer
description:
Southlake, TX

Requisition ID 2025-116764

Category Engineering & Software Development

Position type Regular

Pay range USD $123,000.00 - $140,000.00 / Year

Application deadline 2025-12-01


Your opportunity


At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.

Schwab Technology Services enables the future of how clients manage their money by providing innovative and reliable technology products and services as a part of our ongoing commitment to democratize access to investing and financial planning.

As a member of the SAMS Technology team, you will be immersed in a collaborative, innovative, and technically challenging environment. We're looking for engineers who are enthusiastic about learning new and existing technologies to drive exceptional production resiliency of our software products and systems. The role will require a strong work ethic, problem solving skills, and the ability to partner with business and technologists across the organization. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of successfully supporting enterprise level applications and platforms. The role will require a high level of responsibility and accountability.

The Platform Integration organization contains two teams that specialize in one of the following areas: database support or IT asset management. This role is on the database support team which requires some exposure to database administration task, troubleshooting, and performance tuning. Our organization supports SQL Server, Oracle and PostgreSQL with SQL Server covering the bulk of our applications.

What you have


  • 3-5 years of progressive experience supporting software deployment pipelines, database administration related tasks, and system configuration.
  • Experienced in motivating change through automation, and passionate about adopting and driving a DevOps model.
  • Responsibility for applications support primarily in lower (non-production) environments.
  • Experience with setting, implementing, and reporting on operational critical metrics. Experience in planning, implementation, and support of business application components, including release management and release engineering.
  • Broad and deep knowledge of IT/software technology trends, infrastructure support, application development, public cloud, web services, middleware, operating systems, databases, networking, security, and business intelligence.
  • Agile methodologies and partnering with Agile development teams. Skilled at process design and improvement.
  • Ability to grasp difficult concepts, large architectures, and sophisticated designs quickly.
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related experience.
  • Atlassian suite (JIRA, BitBucket, Confluence, Bamboo). Using CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Atlassian tools, Github, and Remedy.
  • Has worked with cloud-based service models. Experience with PaaS such as Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF).
  • ITIL proficiency using problem management standard methodologies.
  • Database administration skillset to establish data backup and recovery procedures, monitoring, query optimization tasks, and the ability assess data needs for server sizing requirements.
  • Experience with SQL Server, Oracle and PostgreSQL performing DBA tasks and migrating data.
  • Splunk, App Dynamics, Linux & Windows system administration, troubleshooting, and tuning.
  • Experience supporting vendors and SaaS application platforms.
  • Experience working in financial or banking industry.

Job Family-Specific Competencies

  • Written Communication - Expressing oneself clearly in business writing
  • Thoroughness - Ensuring that one’s own and other’s work and information are complete and accurate
    Careful preparation for meetings and presentations
    Following up with others to ensure that agreements and commitments have been fulfilled
  • Software Development - Implementing standards, processes, and methods to create, test, and verify software components, ensuring reliability and resolving operational problems and bugs
  • Oral Communication - Expressing oneself clearly in conversations and interactions with others
  • Incident Response - Resolving reported incidents through streamlined processes, minimizing disruptions, and promptly restoring services
  • Forward Thinking - Anticipating consequences of situations and taking appropriate action to be prepared for possible contingencies


What’s in it for you

At Schwab, you’re empowered to shape your future. We champion your growth through meaningful work, continuous learning, and a culture of trust and collaboration—so you can build the skills to make a lasting impact. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.

We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

  • 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
  • Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
  • Paid parental leave and family building benefits
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance

title: Senior Database Administrator, Oracle
description:
About Aspira

For more than 40 years, Aspira has been the market-leading provider of software and services that help public agencies protect natural and cultural resources while making them accessible for all. Our platform supports everything from campground reservations to hunting licenses, helping millions of people discover, enjoy, and care for the outdoors.

We share our client partners' mission: to steward resources for future generations, create opportunities for genuine enjoyment of the outdoors today, and expand access so more people can experience its benefits.

Aspira is transforming its technology and service model to give agencies more capacity and insight—streamlined tools, smarter automation, and better connections with their communities. Our goal is simple: make it easier for our clients to conserve what matters most and for their customers to enjoy it to the fullest.

The Ideal Candidate

Aspira's Senior Database Administrator is a resource that manages, maintains, and secures data in one or more data systems that enable users and applications to perform critical business operations. Responsible for owning the data storage, compute infrastructure, organization, presentation, utilization, and security for each of the database systems for the company, which span development through to production environments, and from internal only through to customer facing environments. Playing a critical role in ensuring the backbone to countless systems remains functional and available, and enabling Aspira's systems and users to perform their given roles, incumbent spearheads position to achieve annual department goals and key performance indicators (KPIs).

Key Responsibilities

Maintenance and Support

  • Design, develop, and maintain Oracle, Microsoft SQLServer, and PostgreSQL databases and associated systems to meet business requirements
  • Perform database tuning and optimization to ensure high performance and availability
  • Implement and manage database security measures to protect sensitive data
  • Monitor and troubleshoot database issues, ensuring timely resolution
  • Collaborate with software developers, system administrators, and other stakeholders to support database-related projects
  • Develop and maintain documentation for database design, implementation, and maintenance procedures
  • Conduct regular database backups and recovery operations
  • Maintain complex data replication environments for High Availability, redundancy, analytics pipelines, and customer facing reporting and data delivery systems
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest database technologies, trends, and best practices

Cloud-Based Solutions on AWS

  • Architect and deploy scalable, cloud-based database solutions leveraging AWS services such as EC2, RDS, and purpose driven AWS managed database services
  • Utilize AWS CloudFormation for automating infrastructure provisioning and management.
  • Use AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) for seamless data migration across different database platforms
  • Leverage AWS CloudWatch to provide system health tracking and problem diagnosis

Qualifications

  • Good people skills with a natural ability to work with and support colleagues, and an ability to adapt to and work effectively with clients and co-workers with different styles and levels of technical knowledge.
  • Ability to work proficiently in a fast-paced environment while adapting to changing deadlines and priorities.
  • Composes effective and appropriate written and verbal communication for all organizational levels.
  • Detail-oriented, displaying an ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously with strong organizational skills and effectiveness under pressure with tight timeframes.
  • Possesses a natural sense of urgency in achieving business goals and uses those skills to motivate others and create positive momentum.
  • Initiative-taking, responsive, results-oriented, and resourceful; possessing the highest level of integrity and motivation.
  • Leads by example; inspiring and demonstrating Aspira's core values and dedication to the Company's missions.
  • Ability to work independently while being accountable to a team and actively contributes innovative ideas, methods, or initiatives to improve Aspira's database performance, objectives, results, and commitment.
  • Willing to take on work you're unfamiliar with an eagerness to learn
  • Possess a strong sense of ownership for tasks, seeing them through to completion

Desired Education and Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in information technology or other related discipline. A combination of related experienced and education will be considered
  • 8+ years of experience with relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL)
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with AWS RDS for Oracle, AWS EC2
  • Proven experience with Microsoft Always On Availability Groups and Transactional Replication technologies
  • Experience with database security and data protection measures
  • Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and Python for database management and analytics.
  • Advanced knowledge of database security, performance tuning, and optimization.
  • Hands-on experience with AWS services like EC2, RDS, CloudWatch, CloudFormation, and DMS.

title: Database Manager
description:
Company Overview:

The YWCA El Paso del Norte Region is the largest and most comprehensive YWCA in the United States. We are dedicated to eliminating racism, empowering women, and promoting peace, justice, freedom, and dignity for all.

Be a part of our amazing team—exciting opportunities are waiting for you!

Join us in making a difference while growing your career with purpose and passion.

Employment Includes Free Membership to ANY of our YWCA Locations.

  • Indoor heated pools open year-round for water aerobics.
  • 2 locations for lap swimming East – Central.
  • All locations have weight rooms and cardio equipment.
  • Fitness Classes which include Yoga, Pilates, Aquacise and Zumba.

Full-Time 40Hrs.

JOB SUMMARY:

Under general supervision, supports our Team’s work based on the organizational needs will be responsible for gathering data, preparing reports, analyzing data and statistics. Responsible for enhancing the performance of our organization’s database. Create and implement a standardized database management procedures and overseeing the installation, security and upgrading databases.

  • Regular attendance at Employer's place of business and/or during particular hours, as assigned, is an essential function of this position.
  • Employee must comply with and follow YWCA’s attendance policy at all times, unless a reasonable accommodation is requested and granted, as required by law.
  • Enhance the scalability and performance of existing database architecture.
  • Protect data by developing data security and restoration policies, procedures and controls.
  • Conduct diagnostic tests and evaluate performance metrics.
  • Develop procedures to ensure data integrity and quality.
  • Provide technical end-user support to include researching user complaints, researching issues, answering technical questions, and/or assisting with application revisions.
  • Prepare and present system performance reports to senior managers.
  • Maintains a variety of records and documentation for assigned area of responsibility.
  • Perform database maintenance, migration and upgrading hardware and software.
  • Document processes and comply with best practices in database management.
  • Provide training on a regular basis for new and existing software systems to include developing technical user manuals, end-user training manuals.
  • Work with internal and external resources to provide solutions to software systems issues.
  • Design, develop, and maintain SQL queries, views, and stored procedures to support operational reporting and analytics.
  • Create and publish interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide program and leadership staff with key performance metrics.
  • Develop and maintain simple business applications using Power Apps to automate workflows and data collection processes.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, identify data needs, and improve data quality and reporting accuracy.
  • Install, configure, and support computer equipment, peripherals, and related technology for end users.
  • Assist with program-related technology needs and coordinate with IT to ensure reliable service delivery.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in management information systems (MIS), computer science, information systems or information technology from an accredited university preferred.
  • At least two (2) years of experience in database management.
  • Advanced proficiency in Structural Query Language (SQL).
  • In-depth knowledge of database management.
  • Experience building reports and dashboards using Power BI (preferred).
  • Experience developing applications in Power Apps (preferred).
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Knowledge of best practices in database management.
  • Advance analytical, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
  • Must have good analytical skills and be detailed oriented.
  • Must be able to work under pressure with frequent interruptions.
  • Must be able to work independently and autonomously.
  • Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.

Anticipated Benefits
YWCA Membership and Program Discounts
Basic Life Insurance and Retirement
Medical, Dental, Vision

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 per year

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • Database management: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Database Administrator
description:
The Database Administrator is the primary administrator of Salesforce NPSP and integrated third-party systems. This role ensures data integrity, security, and optimization of Salesforce to support fundraising, ticketing, marketing, finance, and organizational reporting needs. The Database Administrator provides system upkeep, troubleshooting, training, and reporting support across departments to help the organization achieve its strategic goals.


Key Responsibilities

Database Management & System Administration

  • Maintain Salesforce database, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and security.
  • Oversee system upgrades, patches, and new feature implementations.
  • Troubleshoot issues and serve as the primary contact for Salesforce-related problems.
  • Manage integrations with third-party applications (e.g. bookkeeping, ticketing, email marketing, analytics tools, access control).
  • Implement and document standard operating procedures and data management best practices.
  • Conduct regular backups and perform routine system maintenance.

Operations & Data Support

  • Input, track, and maintain payments, contacts, opportunities, campaigns, and related data.
  • Monitor data health; perform audits, deduplication, and data cleanup.
  • Support gift entry, acknowledgement, reconciliation, and development reporting functions.
  • Coordinate with Finance to track impact data, chargebacks, and reconciliations.
  • Collaborate with Marketing and Sales on segmentation, campaigns, dynamic pricing, and inventory management.

Reporting & Analytics

  • Create, maintain, and automate reports, dashboards, and lists to meet departmental and organizational needs.
  • Partner with leadership to track KPIs, monitor trends, and forecast performance.
  • Provide data analysis to support fundraising campaigns, ticket sales tracking, marketing initiatives, and strategic planning.

Training & User Support

  • Provide training and support for Salesforce users across departments.
  • Onboard new employees into Salesforce, including account setup, permissions, and roles.
  • Develop user documentation, onboarding materials, and learning resources.
  • Stay current on Salesforce developments, attending webinars, trainings, and user groups.
  • Serve as liaison with Salesforce consultants to define requirements and customize the platform.

Support Projects & Collaboration

  • Support Technology Systems & Knowledge Manager on assigned projects.
  • Lead or participate in internal user groups to share knowledge, resolve issues, and identify improvement opportunities.

Qualifications

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent experience/certification.
  • 3+ years of experience managing a Salesforce organization (NPSP preferred), ideally in non-profit, cultural, or performing arts environment.

Technical Skills

  • Strong skills in Salesforce administration, reporting, and dashboards.
  • Familiarity with SQL, data visualization, and analytics tools preferred.
  • Experience with system integrations and third-party applications.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.

Professional Skills

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate across departments.
  • Highly organized, systems-oriented, and able to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.

title: Site Reliability Engineer / DBA
description:

Plano, TX

title: System Software Engineer Mid-Level
description:
System Software Engineer Mid-Level – San Antonio, TX

MINIMUM/GENERAL EXPERIENCE:

CNF is hiring a team to work onsite in San Antonio, Texas to fulfill the requirement of a System Software Engineer Mid-Level to perform database, replication, and system administration tasks as required for various development, testing, training and exercise environments involving Modernized Integrated Database (MIDB) systems and Global Command and Control Systems – Joint (GCCS-J) in support of the Contract in for the 35IS. The candidate will be based in San Antonio, TX at 35th IS, Lackland AFB, TX.

Knowledge/Experience in the following:

  • Relational database administration (Sybase preferred)
  • SQL experience
  • Understanding of database replication
  • Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Any app server (Wildfly/JBoss preferred), RHEL/CentOS/Solaris, Scripting (Bash, ksh, etc)

FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITY:

System Software Engineer Mid-Level conduct the following:

  • Interface with customers to design, implement, and maintain complex, bridged Sybase replication environments to support scenarios involving cross connected versions of various weapon systems.
  • Use SQL to assist with maintaining data quality across multiple versions of MIDB and GCCS-J.
  • Perform all administration tasks for Sybase Adaptive Server Enterprise (ASE), Sybase Repserver, and Wildfly app servers for the 35IS MIDB and GCCS-J systems.
  • Provide remote assistance in design, maintenance, and recovery of MIDB and GCCS-J Sybase database systems.
  • Utilize your experience and knowledge of troubleshooting errors to assist application developers and testers with integrating their application solutions with our database systems.
  • Design, tune, and implement load test scenarios as requested by the customer.
  • Design, install, configure, and maintain Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) servers on Nutanix hardware.
  • Perform database, app server, and system administration tasks to support implementation of Risk Management Framework (RMF) controls to ensure compliance.
  • Leverage experience with different technologies to assist with administration needs onDell EMC servers, NetApp storage, Nutanix AHV, Prism, Acropolis on Nutanix appliances, and other tools to deliver Enterprise Services to support the cyber security mission of 35th IS information systems (IS) and networks.
  • Respond and resolve service outages, technical queries and other system related issues.
  • Perform system checks (processes, services, network, storage) to ascertain overall system health.
  • Update and document configuration management and troubleshoot any reported problems.
  • Collaborate with the security team on system upgrades and issues.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

DOD Directive 8570 IAT II certification (Security+ or equivalent)

BS/MS (BA/MA) with 5 yrs directly related experience

Or

MS with 2 yrs directly related experience

Accepted Degrees: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, Network Engineering, Information Systems, Or related BS degree

Must have an active Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) clearance

LOCATION:

San Antonio, Texas

title: Sr SQL Database Administrator - Kelsey Seybold Clinic
description:
Explore opportunities with Kelsey-Seybold Clinic, part of the Optum family of businesses. Work with one of the nation's leading health care organizations and build your career at one of our 40+ locations throughout Houston. Be part of a team that is nationally recognized for delivering coordinated and accountable care. As a multi-specialty clinic, we offer care from more than 900 medical providers in 65 medical specialties. Take on a rewarding opportunity to help drive higher quality, higher patient satisfaction and lower total costs. Join us and discover the meaning behind Caring. Connecting. Growing together.


Works collaboratively as a senior member of the Business Intelligence & Reporting team under direction of KSC Application Technology Leadership. Supports, develops, and maintains SQL database environments and related technology. Acts as a team member on multi team projects and uses advanced skill set to develop, test, troubleshoot, and support database-related projects and associated solutions/applications. Acts as mentor to others learning essential and advanced SQL-related skills.


If you are located in Texas, you will have the flexibility to work remotely* as you take on some tough challenges.


Primary Responsibilities:

  • Acts as a project lead or team member on multi-team projects. Uses advanced skill set to develop, test, and implement database/environment-related projects and applications. Participates in database-related planning, change control processes, upgrade, testing, and maintenance
  • Provides general and specialized SQL database/environment-related support. Researches issues, contacts vendors, and uses specialized skills to aid in problem remediation
  • Manages daily operations of assigned database systems and environments. Monitors and maintains uptime and performance data for related database servers, interfaces, and automated processes as required. Acts as mentor to others learning essential and advanced SQL-related skills
  • Provides project management of assigned project components. Creates and maintains technical documentation as it relates to SQL database/environment and provides detailed reporting of all project activities to supervisor/manager
  • Provides for level 3 support regarding all database issues. Other duties assigned


You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical area or equivalent work experience
  • 6+ years of experience in SQL database administration
  • Advanced technical competency in one or more of the following:
    • MS SQL Server Administration
    • Indexing strategies and maintenance
    • Backup and recovery models
    • Clustering and high availability
    • Performance Tuning of Hardware & MS SQL Server
    • MS SQL Transact SQL Programming (T-SQL)
    • Server Monitoring
    • Power shell scripting
  • Database modeling / normalization
  • MS SQL Data Transformation Services Services (SSIS) Administration
  • MS SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) Administration
  • MS SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) Administration


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Advanced degree
  • SQL database-related work experience in a healthcare industry, large-scale data warehousing, and/or exposure to Epic Systems Clarity
  • Advanced certification including:
    • MCDBA
    • MCTS
    • MCITP
    • Vendor Certified SQL Administrator
    • Other database-related certification/s
  • Flexibility and the ability to adapt to change
  • Proven communication, presentation, analytical, problem solving, technical and writing skills. Candidates must have a positive "can do" attitude and a professional demeanor


  • All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group's Telecommuter Policy


Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with us, you'll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. The salary for this role will range from $89,900 to $160,600 annually based on full-time employment. We comply with all minimum wage laws as applicable.


At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone-of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income-deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.


OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer under applicable law and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.


OptumCare is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: LEAD IT ANALYST - SR. IT ANALYST - Oracle Database Administrator
description:
Who We Are:

Join the SwRI ITC Support Services team that provides Oracle database support for the Institute Enterprise Resources Planning (ERP), and other databases as needed. Hybrid schedule is available.

Objectives of this Role:
  • Serve as database analyst and administrator for the Institute's Oracle based ERP system and other databases.
  • This is a critical position for the Institute that allows for carrying out the day to day activities of the Institute.
  • Provide assistance in resolving issues and maintaining the core Oracle database environment as well as ERP software, Deltek Costpoint and other supplemental applications as needed.
  • Work with a team to evaluate new technologies such as cloud and new Oracle architecture features.
Daily and Monthly Responsibilities:
  • Provide support to the ERP, Deltek's Costpoint product, to include upgrades, troubleshooting, and initiation of support calls.
  • Database responsibilities include providing support to Oracle system maintenance, database backups & restores, and database upgrade tasks.
  • For an on-premises Oracle environment on a UNIX platform.
  • Evaluate cloud technologies to support database instances.
  • Assist in the performing performance monitoring and tuning on Oracle databases.
Requirements:
  • Requires a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, any related degree in Information Technology.
  • Continuing education and related certifications (Oracle certifications) plus 10 years of directly related professional level experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
  • With a Bachelors degree; 6 years of experience as an Oracle database administrator, or in a supporting role to database administration. Tasks supported to include performing installs, upgrades and migrations of Oracle software in an Enterprise environment on a UNIX/Linux based platform.
  • 1 years: Customer experience interfacing with end users in support of an ERP system or application. Ability to interface and facilitate issues with the ERP with end users and vendor.
  • 1 years: Experience or working knowledge with the use of Oracle's RMAN, and Data Guard products for high availability and disaster recovery.
  • 1 years: Experience or working knowledge with hosting databases in the cloud, and with Oracle Weblogic Application Server preferred. Experience with Costpoint a plus.

Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Applicant must be a U.S. citizen.


An Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, and veteran status.

CYB10,CYB11,ISM,IT,ITS,Z Prefix


Under the general supervision of the Branch Manager in the Public Health Applications Division of Texas Health & Human Services (HHS) IT, serves as a Senior Database Administrator performing highly advanced (Senior-level) database administration work. Work involves providing for efficient and effective storage, retrieval, customization, and archiving of data to ensure integrated database systems. The Database Administrator will ensure that data is available to users; data remains consistent across the database; is clearly defined and there is provision for data security and recovery control (ensuring all data is retrievable in an emergency), maintain the integrity, performance and security of the databases of many SQL application databases, Mongo DB and PostgreSQL Database. This Database Administrator is responsible for the maintenance, administration, and performance of databases including SQL server. The DBA is a key player in maximizing database performance. Main responsibilities are keeping the databases up and running all the time. Ability to do DML and DLL script deployments to various environments. Daily monitoring of the applications for their uptime, and error resolutions. This position provides product and/or process expertise necessary to support design, development, testing and execution of solutions, utilizes business and technical knowledge of server platforms/operating systems to develop and support data, databases or vendor products, implements data monitoring solutions to monitor the database performance and evaluate complex information coming from a variety of sources, develops and implements data validation processes, works under minimal supervision, with extensive latitude for initiative and independent judgement, performs advanced analysis and design duties, maintains an understanding of how technology can enhance and offer a range of solutions for continual improvement of processes in order to increase business value and/or improve efficiencies. Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned. Work outside of regular hours may be required.


Must be willing to work onsite at an Austin, TX HHS office three (3), or more, days per week.


Selected candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.


Essential Job Functions (EJFs):


Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.


  • (40%) Coordinates the installation of database software and migrations to new data management system software levels and ensures that migrations are appropriately tested and validated. Coordinates and provides application and database operations triage support to troubleshoot and resolve functional and performance issues encountered in production, development and test environments. Provides advanced database development and oversee modifies and/or maintains database structures. Performs logical and physical data modeling, evaluates relational database models, and reviews physical data models created from logical data models. (40%)
  • Plans and databases, as well as in troubleshooting any issues on behalf of the users. Knowledge and experience in development and maintenance of PostgreSQL databases. Installing and configuring PostgreSQL databases, ensuring security through access control and auditing, maintaining performance through tuning and monitoring, and managing data integrity with regular backups, disaster recovery plans. Collaborate with developers on database design and feature implementation, maintain documentation, and provide technical support for database-related issues. Communicate regularly with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security. Control access permissions and privileges. (30%)
  • Make requested changes, updates and modifications to the database structure and data to ensure security, integrity, stability and system availability. Prepare regular reports to summarize all database operating issues and appropriate resolutions. (10%)
  • Maintain database backup and recovery infrastructure. (10%)
  • Assists in developing strategic plans. Assists in developing agency data processing plans, budgets and justification. May prepare management level reports, such as priority lists, quarterly reports, and operating plan. Advise management of the status and progress of projects and other tasks being conducted. (5%)
  • Other duties assigned include but are not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location. (5%)

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):


  • Knowledge of cloud database management, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS – SQL server integration.
  • Advanced skill with SQL server administration functions
  • Skill with SQL performance tuning and optimization
  • Skill with SQL high availability and disaster recovery
  • Skill with SQL database security, SQL scripting and automation, monitoring and alerting
  • Skilled with PostgreSQL
  • Skilled in MongoDB administration, replication and sharding, Experience in complex enterprise level deployments, and providing top-tier support.
  • Ability to complete performance tuning, high availability, large scale production environment monitoring and maintenance.

Registrations, Licensure Requirements or Certifications:


Certification in Mongo DB or PostgreSQL preferred.


Initial Screening Criteria:

  • A bachelor’s degree in a computer-related field, computer science or information technology, is required.
  • A master’s degree in a computer-related field is preferred.
  • 3 to 5 years of experience in specific database software including one, or more, of the following is required: SQL, Microsoft Azure, MongoDB, PostgreSQL.
  • 3 to 5 years of hands on work experience experience as a Database Administrator is required.

Additional Information:

Any employment offer is contingent upon available budgeted funds. The offered salary will be determined in accordance with budgetary limits and the requirements of HHSC Human Resources Manual.

  • Selected candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
  • The selected candidate must be willing to work from an HHS office located in Austin, designated by the hiring manager.

Review our Tips for Success when applying for jobs at DFPS, DSHS and HHSC.


Active Duty, Military, Reservists, Guardsmen, and Veterans:

Military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position may include, but not limited to those listed in this posting. All active-duty military, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply if qualified to fill this position. For more information please see the Texas State Auditor’s Job Descriptions, Military Crosswalk and Military Crosswalk Guide at Texas State Auditor's Office - Job Descriptions.


ADA Accommodations:

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHSC and DSHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview.


Pre-Employment Checks and Work Eligibility:

title: Financial Database Administrator - Disaster Management - Remote (US)
description:
Description

Build a Rewarding Future at ICF!

ICF’s Disaster Management Division is looking a Financial Database Administrator – Disaster Management with experience in database administration to ensure secure, reliable, and high-performing data systems supporting disaster management and financial oversight. This position is 100% Remote United States with ability to travel. Preference given to Austin, Texas area, which would be a Hybrid job for that area. This position is experienced, non-supervisory, non-managerial level.

  • As a Financial Database Administrator, you will play a critical role in ensuring our data infrastructure is secure, reliable, and high performing. You’ll be responsible day one for installing and configuring database systems, managing user access and permissions to safeguard sensitive information, and implementing robust backup and recovery strategies to protect against data loss. Your expertise will drive ongoing performance tuning and optimization, ensuring our databases run efficiently and support business needs seamlessly. You’ll maintain data integrity and accuracy, keep systems up to date with the latest patches and upgrades, and proactively troubleshoot any issues that arise. Additionally, you’ll document configurations and procedures, contributing to a well-organized and resilient data environment that supports our organization’s growth and success.

You are a driven professional with deep experience in state and local government, specializing in federally funded disaster recovery and mitigation. Your current toolkit includes project management platforms, database creation and administration, financial reporting systems, and data analytics. You consistently deliver high-impact results aligned with ICF’s values—ensuring quality, meeting deadlines, and improving processes. Proactive and self-reliant, you thrive in collaborative, inclusive teams and eagerly embrace new challenges to grow your skills and support client success.

Compensation: While the range below is broader, this position will offer a base salary of 75K to 85K. Offer based on candidate’s % of job description match and location. Compensation for this position is limited to this base salary range and the great full-time ICF benefits package for this level. No additional costs, fringe benefits, or compensation beyond what is outlined will be provided at this time.

At ICF, you don’t just support disaster recovery—you help communities rebuild stronger, smarter, and more resilient than ever. The Disaster Management Division offers the chance to work on high-impact, mission-driven projects alongside passionate experts, all while growing your career in a collaborative, values-driven environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and buildout functionality developed for clients in the Quickbase low-code platform. This includes monitoring and updating user permissions, building out additional modules to provide new functionality, updating data migration processes, and reconciling or QC’ing existing databanks. We manage a complex application that consolidates a web of databases into a single source for reporting. Ensuring the integrity of this database will be your primary responsibility.
  • Support state and local governments to successfully administer grant programs by leveraging knowledge of their systems of records and maintaining an understanding of the internal challenges. Provide tailored guidance based on our knowledge of the various systems GLO interacts with to ensure the correct reports and tools are being provided.
  • Develop and update job aid materials and SOPs to ensure consistency, while providing clear system navigation instructions. Ensure all documentations adhere to relevant federal and state laws, regulations, and CDBG-DR/MIT requirements, including checklists, procedural guides, process flowcharts, and training resources.
  • Provide onsite technical assistance and training to state and local government agencies on programmatic systems and procedural requirements.
  • Fulfill assigned responsibilities accurately and in a timely manner to ensure all tasks are completed by the designated due date, while proactively communicating any delays or knowledge gaps that may impact successful task completion.
  • Deliver comprehensive financial system and data integrity support to promote accurate reporting within federal, state, and local government systems of record.
  • Maintain a results-oriented approach to support the client in achieving audit readiness.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in reconciling complex financial data.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel functions (complex functions, Power Query, Pivot Tables).
  • Ability to work independently, manage deadlines, and proactively address client needs and expectations.
  • Collaborate with leads, peers, and the client to review, update and implement policies, procedures and best practices. Regularly participate and engage in management, strategy, and problem-solving meetings to effectively address client’s needs and requirements.

Please provide a well-written resume aligned to the qualifications, skills and experience required. Work examples may be requested as attachments and/or live demo.

Minimum Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in management information systems, finance, accounting, or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data analytics and reporting using common business intelligence tools, such as Power BI.
  • 3+ years of recent experience in reporting, analytics, and financial database administration (*see above).
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience writing technical guidance or procedures, examples SOP, functional specs.
  • Advance knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including the use of pivot tables and self-creation of advanced formulas).
  • Willing and able to travel (flight and vehicle) for work as needed with minimal notice.

Preferred Skills/Experience: (These may set candidates apart)

  • Public Sector experience, such as state and local government working with federal grants.
  • 3+ years of CDBG and/or CDBG-DR/MIT experience.
  • Familiarity with HUDs DRGR Reporting system or Texas’ TIGR reporting system
  • Experience with data analysis, visualization, and manipulation using tools like Excel, Power BI, Python, Quickbase, Jet Reports, Tableau.
  • Grant Accounting, Public Accounting, Budgeting
  • Experience with Agile Methodology
  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365.
  • Experience in delivering training and technical assistance.
  • Experience with creation of CDBG-DR/MIT subject-related materials, such as training and technical assistance tools, presentations, handouts, etc.
  • Experience working in Texas within a Federal, State and/or City financial role.

Professional Skills: (You bring these skills with you day one)

  • Highly detail-oriented and organized, with a strong understanding of federal, state and local government regulations.
  • Collaborate effectively with teams such as program management, finance, business analysis and technical support.
  • Demonstrate resourcefulness, strong analytical abilities and proficiency in conducting subject matter research to apply critical thinking skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills to identify system deficiencies, address data integrity issues, and offer solution-focused recommendations.
  • Ability to execute project plans, maintain schedules, and forecast activities.
  • Self-motivated with ability to work independently with attention to detail and strong time management.

Working at ICF

ICF is a global advisory and technology services provider, but we’re not your typical consultants. We combine unmatched expertise with cutting-edge technology to help clients solve their most complex challenges, navigate change, and shape the future.

We can only solve the world's toughest challenges by building a workplace that allows everyone to thrive. We are an equal opportunity employer. However, we understand that some candidates may require accommodation that involves the use of AI. If such an accommodation is needed, candidates are instructed to contact us in advance at candidateaccommodation@icf.com. We are dedicated to providing the necessary support to ensure that all candidates have an equal opportunity to succeed.
